update.description:
Builds on top of pull request #128

---

Remove everything related to QSS stylesheets and use QtQuick Controls 2 Styles instead.

See tutorial for documentation.

This is an initial implementation, some possible future features:

* First-class support for Default and Universal styles
* Command line arguments
* Examples setting style from C++

---

Demo:

![styles_opt.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1625201647-styles_opt.gif)
update.title: [gz11] Style

content.raw: argh sorry, I messed up when changing from `indexOf` to `endsWith`. Should be fixed now: 93314ae
content.html: argh sorry, I messed up when changing from indexOf to endsWith. Should be fixed now: 93314ae

update.description:
Builds on top of pull request #128

---

Remove everything related to QSS stylesheets and use QtQuick Controls 2 Styles instead.

See tutorial for documentation.

This is an initial implementation, some possible future features:

* First-class support for Default and Universal styles
* Command line arguments

---

Demo:

update.title: [gz11] Style

content.raw:
Yes, the file doesn't appear because we're explicitly filtering for `.config` files [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/990ea42885990354a19898a1a844869cf5ecbaaf/include/ignition/gui/qml/Main.qml?at=gz11&fileviewer=file-view-default#Main.qml-204). We can change that to accept any file.

I'll see if I can enforce saving with a `.config` extension.
content.html:
Yes, the file doesn't appear because we're explicitly filtering for .config files here. We can change that to accept any file.

I'll see if I can enforce saving with a .config extension.

content.raw: By “can’t load” I mean I can’t load the configuration through the GUI. The file does not appear in the dialog box, and I can’t select it.
content.html: By “can’t load” I mean I can’t load the configuration through the GUI. The file does not appear in the dialog box, and I can’t select it.

content.raw:
I don’t get an error, just bad behavior. If I don’t manually add the “.config” extension, then I can’t load a configuration file. 

One solution would add the “.config” file extension if it’s not present.
content.html:
I don’t get an error, just bad behavior. If I don’t manually add the “.config” extension, then I can’t load a configuration file.

One solution would add the “.config” file extension if it’s not present.

Builds on top of pull request #128

---

Remove everything related to QSS stylesheets and use QtQuick Controls 2 Styles instead.

See tutorial for documentation.

update.title: [gz11] Style

content.raw:
I just checked that you can load it through the command line, i.e.:

`ign gui -c myconfig`

But the UI is set to only display `.config` files. I can remove the filter if you want.
content.html:
I just checked that you can load it through the command line, i.e.:

ign gui -c myconfig

But the UI is set to only display .config files. I can remove the filter if you want.

content.raw: I've tested using `.config`, I think the file dialog is the one filtering. What error do you get?
content.html: I've tested using .config, I think the file dialog is the one filtering. What error do you get?

content.raw: The only problem I have is with saving and loading config files. When I save a config to “myconfig”, then I can’t load that config file back. Is the load dialog expecting a certain filename extension?
content.html: The only problem I have is with saving and loading config files. When I save a config to “myconfig”, then I can’t load that config file back. Is the load dialog expecting a certain filename extension?
